page.title: 12PLAYGROUND GAMES,CROFT.
page.content: Lots of games which we play today are variations of the games that children played many years ago. These include marbles,hopscotch, skipping and hide- and-seek.The boys enjoy playing football on the yard and British Bull- dog. The girls like playing make- belief games best. Boys and girls often play together in a game of tig, or girls after boys. Our playground is marked for netball, hopscotch and there series of circles and lines painted for children to play on.We also have a large brick playwall which we use to kick or throw a ball at, or for cricket. British Bulldog is just one of the games we play across the yard. We use the netball markings for "Farmer", "Pully", "Peggy-leggy" and different kinds of "Polo".
